intro: Eritrichium uralense, commonly known as the Siberian mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the cold regions of Central Asia and Eastern Europe. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches a height of about 10–20 centimeters. The plant features small, hairy leaves and produces delicate blue or purple flowers in early spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subarctic environments. Eritrichium uralense is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in cooler climates.
